rnalysis.name: RNAlysis
rnalysis.citation:
Teichman, G., Cohen, D., Ganon, O., Dunsky, N., Shani, S., Gingold, H., and Rechavi, O. (2022). RNAlysis: analyze your RNA sequencing data without writing a single line of code. BioRxiv 2022.11.25.517851.
doi.org/10.1101/2022.11.25.517851

cutadapt.name: the CutAdapt adapter trimming tool
cutadapt.citation:
Martin, M. (2011). Cutadapt removes adapter sequences from high-throughput sequencing reads. EMBnet.journal, 17(1), pp. 10-12.
doi.org/10.14806/ej.17.1.200

kallisto.name: the kallisto RNA sequencing quantification tool
kallisto.citation:
Bray, N., Pimentel, H., Melsted, P. et al. Near-optimal probabilistic RNA-seq quantification. Nat Biotechnol 34, 525–527 (2016).
doi.org/10.1038/nbt.3519

bowtie2.name: the bowtie2 aligner
bowtie2.citation: Langmead, B., and Salzberg, S.L. (2012). Fast gapped-read alignment with Bowtie 2. Nat. Methods 2012 94 9, 357–359. doi.org/10.1038/nmeth.1923

featurecounts.name: the featureCounts read summarization program
featurecounts.citation: Yang Liao, Gordon K. Smyth, Wei Shi (2013). featureCounts: an efficient general purpose program for assigning sequence reads to genomic features. Bioinformatics, Volume 30, Issue 7, April 2014, Pages 923–930. doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btt656

deseq2.name: the DESeq2 differential expression program
deseq2.citation:
Love MI, Huber W, Anders S (2014). Moderated estimation of fold change and dispersion for RNA-seq data with DESeq2. Genome Biology, 15, 550.
doi.org/10.1186/s13059-014-0550-8

limma.name: the Limma-Voom differential expression pipeline
limma.citation:
Ritchie, M.E., Phipson, B., Wu, D., Hu, Y., Law, C.W., Shi, W., and Smyth, G.K. (2015). limma powers differential expression analyses for RNA-sequencing and microarray studies. Nucleic Acids Res. 43, e47–e47. doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkv007

Law, C.W., Chen, Y., Shi, W., and Smyth, G.K. (2014). Voom: Precision weights unlock linear model analysis tools for RNA-seq read counts. Genome Biol. 15, 1–17. doi.org/10.1186/gb-2014-15-2-r29

hdbscan.name: the HDBSCAN clustering method
hdbscan.citation:
L. McInnes, J. Healy, S. Astels, hdbscan: Hierarchical density based clustering In: Journal of Open Source Software, The Open Journal, volume 2, number 11. 2017
doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.0030039

xlmhg.name: the XL-mHG single-set enrichment test
xlmhg.citation:
Eden, E., Lipson, D., Yogev, S., and Yakhini, Z. (2007). Discovering Motifs in Ranked Lists of DNA Sequences. PLOS Comput. Biol. 3, e39.
doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.0030039

Wagner, F. (2017). The XL-mHG test for gene set enrichment. ArXiv.
doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.1507.07905
